New Records: Suryakumar Yadav became the first Indian and only second in the world to score 1000 runs in T20Is in a calendar year.
Ashwin surpassed Jasprit Bumrah to become the third-highest leading wicket-taker for India in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Rahul and Suryakumar set the tone for India with a magnificent 62-run knock and a 23-ball fifty respectively.
India picked two wickets in their first over, sending back Madhevere on a golden duck and Chakabva in a single over.
India's bowlers were on roll, with fast bowlers performing well and Ashwin's breakthroughs.
India got a big 71-run win over Zimbabwe, setting a high total of 185-3 in the first innings.
Zimbabwe struggled to chase down the target, getting bowled out for 115 in the second innings.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma won the toss and chose to bat first.
India decided to play Rishabh Pant ahead of Dinesh Karthik in the final Super 12 game.
India's captain Rohit Sharma has become the third Indian captain after MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli to lead India in 50 T20Is.
Zimbabwe made two changes to their playing XI, with Wellington and Munyonga coming in, and Milton and Luke Jongwe out.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav expressed pride in the team's performance and the milestone achieved.
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Ashwin's achievement was noted as a significant milestone for Indian cricket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Indian fans have reached in big numbers for India's final Super 12 game in Melbourne.
The match took place at the iconic MCG.
The weather in Melbourne was clear with a slight chance of showers.
